required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pregnancy Registry to Collect Long-Term Safety Data From Women Treated With HyQvia (Immune Globulin (Human) 10% With rHuPH20)
clinical_study.official_title: Pregnancy Registry to Collect Long-Term Safety Data From Women Treated With HyQvia (Immune Globulin (Human) 10% With rHuPH20)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this registry is to acquire safety data (including assessment of anti-rHuPH20 antibodies), regarding the course and outcome of pregnancy in women ever treated with HYQVIA. Development of the fetus/infant at birth and for the first 2 years will also be followed.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all serious adverse events (expectant mother and infant)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of non-serious adverse events (expectant mother and infant)
secondary_outcome.description: Related and not-related to HYQVIA/Human normal immunoglobulin or alternative treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of local/immunologic adverse events (expectant mother)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 40 weeks, ie throughout pregnancy, and up to 6 months after delivery for final / study close out visit
secondary_outcome.description: Including skin changes (such as: local erythema, local pruritus, induration, nodules)

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of antibodies against recombinant human hyaluronidase (rHuPH20)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 40 weeks, ie throughout pregnancy, and up to 6 months after delivery for final / study close out visit
Up to approximately 40 weeks, ie throughout pregnancy
Up to approximately 40 weeks, ie throughout pregnancy
At or after delivery/end of pregnancy
At or after delivery/end of pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Status of the infant at birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At or after delivery/end of pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth measurement and charts for the infant

secondary_outcome.description: Determined by standard test methods for each region

arm_group.description: Participant stops HYQVIA treatment (if the participant is still treated) and a licensed human normal immunoglobulin other than HYQVIA for intravenous (IV) or subcutaneous (SC) infusion or an alternative treatment will be administered, as determined by the physician.
Participant continues to receive HYQVIA (Immune Globulin (Human) 10% with recombinant human hyaluronidase (rHuPH20)), according to her treatment regimen.

intervention.intervention_name: A licensed human normal immunoglobulin other than HYQVIA for IV or SC infusion or an alternative treatment
intervention.description: To be determined by the physician

intervention.intervention_name: HYQVIA [Immune Globulin Infusion 10% (Human) with Recombinant Human Hyaluronidase]

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples (plasma) for antibodies against recombinant human hyaluronidase (rHuPH20) that remain after study testing is done may be stored and used for additional testing (eg, further evaluation of an abnormal test or an adverse event). Samples will be stored in a coded form for a maximum of 2 years after the final study report has been completed and, subsequently, will be destroyed.

study_pop.textblock: Women who became pregnant after ever treated with HYQVIA, and their infant children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For the expectant mother only: Participant became pregnant during or after treatment with HYQVIA
- Participant/Participant's legally authorized representative is willing to sign an informed consent form (ICF)
Exclusion Criteria:
- There are no applicable Exclusion Criteria

facility.name: Freiburg University Hospital/ Prof. Dr. med. Bodo Grimbacher
